through matter.

He actually did some work in

In 1870, he described what survives to this day as the Fick Principle
for determining cardiac output and

basically equates the amount of
uptake of oxygen by the lungs with the amount that should be
distributed in the blood. But you have to take arterial oxygen
pressure minus venal oxygen pressure

to get the efficiency of the heart.
